info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 3:58PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN MCDOWELL...NORTHWESTERN RUTHERFORD...NORTHEASTERN HENDERSON AND SOUTHEASTERN BUNCOMBE COUNTIES UNTIL 430 PM EDT... At 358 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with torrential rainfall 11 miles east of Downtown Asheville, or near Fairview In Buncombe County, moving northeast at 10 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Black Mountain, Swannanoa, Fairview In Buncombe County, Chimney Rock Village, Chimney Rock State Park, Bat Cave, Warren Wilson College, Lake Lure, Montreat and Gerton. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
